reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Reinforcement more safe, cohesive and accessible protection environment for crisis-affected and at-risk "MWBG" especially IDPs, and new returnees through providing quality and inclusive protection interventions (CP - GP - Mine Action) in Idlib, Ariha, and Al-Bab Sub-districts

description.narrative:
Project has designed based on recent updates in northwest of Syria, to cover 3 protection sub-clusters: CP, GP, MA, targeting the critical needs of IDPs and returnees in 7 communities: (Korin, Mastumeh, Idlib)in Ariha and Idlib sub-districts,(Hazwan, Sosyan, Al-Bab, Qabasin(Zamak)in Albab sub-district. Within project MWL will expand protection services through Korin protection center and 4 mobile teams to reach beneficiaries in 3 communities in Idlib. In addition to establish new community protection center in Al-Bab city and 4 mobile teams. Each mobile team contains 4 members: 1 team leader and 3 team workers(CP, GP, MA). Project will serve (85200) of most vulnerable (M:14550, W:19150, B:25350, G:26150) including (PWD:1440) through following protection interventions: 1- CP: targeting 27,360 of most vulnerable children, and their caregivers “M:1630, W:3230, B:10,850,G:11650), including CWD:925” through: full CM services amp Emergency Case Fund (ECF) Create and distribute videos contain the curriculum of structured PSS Conduct PSS activities and awareness-raising sessions Establish 8 child protection networks Provide training on communication and service delivery modality during COVID19 Establish CP Emergency focal point system in Al-Bab Sub-district to provide support of CP cluster materials distribution, referrals, and report to CP Monitoring group
2- GP: targeting 31,810 “M:9905, W:12905, B:4500, G:4500” especially PWD, elderly, persons with protection concerns in targeted locations, through -Conduct awareness-raising sessions on protection risks, avoidance, remedies with focusing on safety messages in pandemics -Establish Protection Help Desks and provide supportive information -Establish 2 multi-sectoral referral pathways and service mapping in the targeted locations, -Support protection committees to work on concerns related to COVID 19 -Conduct periodic KII and report to PMTF on protection concerns -Conduct awareness-raising activities with Key messaging and community mobilization interventions on PSEA -Deliver comprehensive CM amp IPA services to most vulnerable people.
3-Mine action services: targeting 26030, “M:3015, W:3015, B:10000, G:10000” by providing risk education activities. Project will target most vulnerable and at-risk groups in the situation of COVID19, through tailoring the modality of delivering the activities, using following methods: -Conduct activities in small groups and keep the suitable required distance between participants taking into consideration all safety steps (gloves / Masks/ Sanitizer) -Conduct home visits to implement sessions in participant’s home as necessary -Deliver the activities through online methods: WhatsApp groups, social media platforms, online meetings, radio streaming (more details in other sectionsampannexs)

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
